channel.title: Kicksecure login: "enter" key not working
channel.description:
Hi, I installed debian (on a encrypted LVM) then installed kicksecure as described in the wiki.
I rebooted my pc and on the login page I can't login because the "enter" key is not working. Am I doing something wrong?
Laslty, a bit off topic: it's ok to use kicksecure as the host machine for whonix? Thanks.

item.title: Kicksecure login: "enter" key not working
item.dc:creator: jjwe
item.description:
Yeah i installed debian 10 with plasma/kde and SDDM.

Read full topic

item.title: Kicksecure login: "enter" key not working
item.dc:creator: DJEQKFiCy8JR8Ktu
item.description:
The same thing also happened to me with SDDM.

The steps to reproduce this are the following:

Debian 10.3 netinstall, chose no DE.

sudo apt install kde-plasma-desktop sddm xserver-xorg-core

Follow steps to install Kicksecure/Debian from the wiki.

Reboot

Upon reboot, SDDM appears, you can type in the password, but ENTER does nothing, you cannot login.

Perhaps an SDDM related thing?

@jjwe Were you also using SDDM/KDE?

If anyone has time to test this with other login managers, please report back.

Read full topic

item.title: Kicksecure login: "enter" key not working
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
No idea.

Laslty, a bit off topic: it’s ok to use kicksecure as the host machine for whonix?

Yes.

Read full topic
